intro: Hyoscyamus senecionis var. bipinnatisectus, commonly known as the bipinnatisect hyoscyamus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its compound, bipinnatisected leaves that give it a finely divided appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months, and its fruits are follicles containing toxic seeds. Due to its toxic properties, it is not typically cultivated for ornamental or agricultural purposes.
